title: A Survey on Verification and Validation, Testing and Evaluations of Neurosymbolic Artificial Intelligence. (arXiv:2401.03188v1 [cs.AI])
abstract: Neurosymbolic artificial intelligence (AI) is an emerging branch of AI that combines the strengths of symbolic AI and sub-symbolic AI. A major drawback of sub-symbolic AI is that it acts as a "black box", meaning that predictions are difficult to explain, making the testing & evaluation (T&E) and validation & verification (V&V) processes of a system that uses sub-symbolic AI a challenge. Since neurosymbolic AI combines the advantages of both symbolic and sub-symbolic AI, this survey explores how neurosymbolic applications can ease the V&V process. This survey considers two taxonomies of neurosymbolic AI, evaluates them, and analyzes which algorithms are commonly used as the symbolic and sub-symbolic components in current applications. Additionally, an overview of current techniques for the T&E and V&V processes of these components is provided. Furthermore, it is investigated how the symbolic part is used for T&E and V&V purposes in current neurosymbolic applications. Our research shows

Title: A Survey on Verification and Validation, Testing and Evaluations of Neurosymbolic Artificial Intelligence. (arXiv:2401.03188v1 [cs.AI])
Abstract: Neurosymbolic artificial intelligence (AI) is an emerging branch of AI that combines the strengths of symbolic AI and sub-symbolic AI. A major drawback of sub-symbolic AI is that it acts as a "black box", meaning that predictions are difficult to explain, making the testing & evaluation (T&E) and validation & verification (V&V) processes of a system that uses sub-symbolic AI a challenge. Since neurosymbolic AI combines the advantages of both symbolic and sub-symbolic AI, this survey explores how neurosymbolic applications can ease the V&V process. This survey considers two taxonomies of neurosymbolic AI, evaluates them, and analyzes which algorithms are commonly used as the symbolic and sub-symbolic components in current applications. Additionally, an overview of current techniques for the T&E and V&V processes of these components is provided. Furthermore, it is investigated how the symbolic part is used for T&E and V&V purposes in current neurosymbolic applications. Our research shows
translated_title: 对神经符号人工智能的验证和验证、测试和评估的调查
translated_abstract: 神经符号人工智能是一种新兴的人工智能分支，将符号人工智能和亚符号人工智能的优势相结合。亚符号人工智能的一个主要缺点是它表现为“黑盒”，意味着预测很难解释，使得使用亚符号人工智能系统的测试和评估（T&E）以及验证和验证（V&V）过程成为一项挑战。由于神经符号人工智能结合了符号和亚符号人工智能的优点，本调查探讨了神经符号应用如何简化V&V过程。本调查考虑了两种神经符号人工智能的分类法，并评估了它们，并分析了当前应用中作为符号和亚符号组成部分的常用算法。此外，还提供了关于这些组件的T&E和V&V过程的当前技术概述。此外，还调查了符号部分在当前神经符号应用中如何用于T&E和V&V目的。我们的研究表明
tldr: 神经符号人工智能的验证和验证、测试和评估是一项具有挑战性的任务，因为亚符号人工智能的黑盒特性使得预测难以解释。本调查研究了神经符号人工智能如何简化V&V过程，并提供了关于当前应用的算法和技术的概述。
en_tdlr: The verification and validation, testing and evaluations of neurosymbolic artificial intelligence is a challenging task due to the "black box" nature of sub-symbolic AI. This survey investigates how neurosymbolic AI can simplify the V&V process and provides an overview of the current algorithms and techniques used in applications.
